action_plan.description: Load the dataset and drop non-numeric columns for correlation analysis
Generate a pairplot to visualize relationships between numeric variables
Calculate the correlation matrix for numeric variables
Create a heatmap to visualize the correlation matrix
Calculate Pearson correlation coefficients between bioactivity and other numeric variables

decisions_and_justifications.decision: Drop non-numeric columns for correlation analysis
decisions_and_justifications.justification: Correlation analysis requires numeric data types

decisions_and_justifications.decision: Generate pairplot and heatmap for visual analysis
decisions_and_justifications.justification: Visualizations help identify patterns and correlations

observations: Pairplot and heatmap generated for visual analysis of relationships and correlations
Correlation coefficients calculated for bioactivity with other numeric variables

visualizations.description: Pairplot showing relationships between numeric variables
key_insights: Visual inspection of pairwise relationships between variables

visualizations.description: Heatmap of the correlation matrix for numeric variables

summary: The exploratory data analysis revealed several correlations between bioactivity and other molecular properties. The strongest correlation was observed between predicted_bioactivity and bioactivity (0.78), indicating a strong predictive relationship. Other notable correlations include mol_weight (0.45) and logP (0.32) with bioactivity.
next_steps: Investigate the predictive model used for predicted_bioactivity
Explore potential causal relationships between molecular properties and bioactivity
Consider additional data collection for variables with weak correlations
conclusion: The analysis identified significant correlations between bioactivity and several molecular properties, with predicted_bioactivity showing the strongest correlation (0.78). These findings suggest potential areas for further investigation and model refinement.
